history.proof: intros H. induction ll. - simpl. constructor. - simpl. shelve.

exceptions.tactic: intros X P f ll H.

exceptions.exn: Expects a disjunctive pattern with 2 branches.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
P: X -> Prop
f: X -> bool
ll: list X

Goal:
Forall P ll -> Forall P (filter f ll)

Premises:
filter : forall A : Type, (A -> bool) -> list A -> list A
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Forall : forall A : Type, (A -> Prop) -> list A -> Prop
Forall_map : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (P : Y -> Prop) (ll : list X), Forall P (map f ll) < -> Forall (fun x : X => P (f x)) ll
Forall_impl : forall (X : Type) (P Q : X -> Prop) (ll : list X), (forall x : X, In x ll -> P x -> Q x) -> Forall P ll -> Forall Q ll
Forall_rev : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (ll : list X), Forall P ll -> Forall P (rev ll)
Forall_app : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (ll mm : list X), Forall P (ll ++ mm) < -> Forall P ll /\ Forall P mm
Forall2_Forall : forall (X : Type) (R : X -> X -> Prop) (ll : list X), Forall2 R ll ll < -> Forall (fun x : X => R x x) ll
Forall_cons_inv : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (x : X) (ll : list X), Forall P (x :: ll) < -> P x /\ Forall P ll
Forall_forall_map : forall (X : Type) (f : nat -> X) (n : nat) (l : list X) (P : X -> Prop), l = map f (list_an 0 n) -> (forall i : nat, i < n -> P (f i)) < -> Forall P l
Forall_cons : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> Forall P (x :: l)
incl_Forall : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l1 l2 : list A), incl l2 l1 -> Forall P l1 -> Forall P l2
List.Forall_rev : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l -> Forall P (rev l)
Forall_and : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l -> Forall Q l -> Forall (fun x : A => P x /\ Q x) l
Forall_sind : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : list A -> SProp), P0 nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> P0 l -> P0 (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> P0 l
Forall_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : list A -> Prop), P0 nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> P0 l -> P0 (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> P0 l
List.Forall_impl : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop), (forall a : A, P a -> Q a) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> Forall Q l
Forall_inv_tail : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (a : A) (l : list A), Forall P (a :: l) -> Forall P l
List.Forall_app : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l1 l2 : list A), Forall P (l1 ++ l2) < -> Forall P l1 /\ Forall P l2
Forall_and_inv : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall (fun x : A => P x /\ Q x) l -> Forall P l /\ Forall Q l
ForallOrdPairs_sind : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> SProp), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), Forall (R a) l -> ForallOrdPairs R l -> P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, ForallOrdPairs R l -> P l
ForallOrdPairs_ind : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), Forall (R a) l -> ForallOrdPairs R l -> P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, ForallOrdPairs R l -> P l
Forall_inv : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (a : A) (l : list A), Forall P (a :: l) -> P a
neg_Forall_Exists_neg : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), (forall x : A, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> ~ Forall P l -> Exists (fun x : A => ~ P x) l
Forall_rect : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (Q : list A -> Type), Q nil -> (forall (b : A) (l : list A), P b -> Q (b :: l)) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> Q l
Forall_elt : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (a : A) (l1 l2 : list A), Forall P (l1 ++ a :: l2) -> P a
Forall_forall : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l < -> (forall x : A, In x l -> P x)
Forall_dec : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), (forall x : A, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> forall l : list A, {Forall P l} + {~ Forall P l}
Exists_Forall_neg : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), (forall x : A, P x \/ ~ P x) -> Exists (fun x : A => ~ P x) l < -> ~ Forall P l
exists_Forall : forall (A B : Type) (P : A -> B -> Prop) (l : list B), (exists k : A, Forall (P k) l) -> Forall (fun x : B => exists k : A, P k x) l
Forall_nil : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), Forall P nil
NoDup_filter : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l : list A), NoDup l -> NoDup (filter f l)
Forall_nth : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l < -> (forall (i : nat) (d : A), i < length l -> P (nth i l d))
Forall_Exists_neg : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall (fun x : A => ~ P x) l < -> ~ Exists P l
Field_theory.FExpr_ind : forall (C : Type) (P : Field_theory.FExpr C -> Prop), P Field_theory.FEO -> P Field_theory.FEI -> (forall c : C, P (Field_theory.FEc c)) -> (forall p : BinNums.positive, P (Field_theory.FEX C p)) -> (forall f3 : Field_theory.FExpr C, P f3 -> forall f4 : Field_theory.FExpr C, P f4 -> P (Field_theory.FEadd f3 f4)) -> (forall f4 : Field_theory.FExpr C, P f4 -> forall f5 : Field_theory.FExpr C, P f5 -> P (Field_theory.FEsub f4 f5)) -> (forall f5 : Field_theory.FExpr C, P f5 -> forall f6 : Field_theory.FExpr C, P f6 -> P (Field_theory.FEmul f5 f6)) ->...-> forall f10 : Field_theory.FExpr C, P f10
incl_filter : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l : list A), incl (filter f l) l
Inductive Exists (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : list A -> Prop := Exists_cons_hd : forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Exists P (x :: l) | Exists_cons_tl : forall (x : A) (l : list A), Exists P l -> Exists P (x :: l) Arguments Exists [A]%type_scope _%function_scope _%list_scope Arguments Exists_cons_hd [A]%type_scope _%function_scope _ _%list_scope Arguments Exists_cons_tl [A]%type_scope [P]%function_scope _ [l]%list_scope
Permutation_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), P nil nil -> (forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (x :: l')) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), P (y :: x :: l) (x :: y :: l)) -> (forall l l' l'' : list A, l ~p l' -> P l l' -> l' ~p l'' -> P l' l'' -> P l l'') -> forall l l0 : list A, l ~p l0 -> P l l0
map_ext_Forall : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B) (l : list A), Forall (fun x : A => f x = g x) l -> map f l = map g l
filter_In : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (x : A) (l : list A), In x (filter f l) < -> In x l /\ f x = true
ZifyClasses.rew_iff : forall P Q : Prop, P < -> Q -> P -> Q
concat_filter_map : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l : list (list A)), concat (map (filter f) l) = filter f (concat l)
Forall_fold_right : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l < -> fold_right (fun x : A => and (P x)) True l

```  
intros X P f ll H.
induction ll.
- simpl. constructor.
- simpl. destruct H as [H1 H2].
  destruct (f a) eqn:F.
  + constructor.
    * apply H1.
    * apply IHll. apply H2.
  + apply IHll. apply H2.
```

original: intros X P f ll H. induction ll. - simpl. constructor. - simpl. destruct H as [H1 H2]. destruct (f a) eqn:F. + constructor. * apply H1. * apply IHll. apply H2. + apply IHll. apply H2.
